environment.comment:
This section describes configuration parameters for Curam applications that you can (or in some cases must) set to control characteristics of application execution. Generally, and unless otherwise noted, these parameters are set in property and prx files associated with your application.
The following configuration parameter descriptions are organized according to the file that they should be set in and also in functionally-related groups.
Some parameters are of a "BOOLEAN" type, where noted. This means that the value "true" or "yes" in upper-, lower-, or mixed-case, equates to a "true" value; all other values (or none) equate to "false". The configuration parameter descriptions are grouped into functionally-related groups.

type.name: Bootstrap.properties
type.comment: The following properties relate to the Bootstrap.properties file.

section.name: Database
section.comment: These settings configure Curam for database communication.

variable.name: curam.db.type
variable.comment: The property which specifies the database type. Suggested: DB2/ORA/ZOS.

variable.name: curam.db.password
variable.comment: The encrypted password that corresponds to the user name specified above. The database password is never stored in plaintext in the various Curam property files.

variable.name: curam.db.username
variable.comment: A valid database username.

variable.name: curam.db.oracle.cachesize
variable.comment: The size of the prepared statement cache used by batch programs when run against Oracle (the prepared statement cache is based around implicit caching).

variable.name: curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.enabled
variable.comment: Turn on connection caching for Oracle outside of an Application Server.

variable.name: curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.minlimit
variable.comment: Set Min Limit for the Cache. This sets the minimum number of PooledConnections that the cache maintains. This guarantees that the cache will not shrink below this minimum limit.

variable.name: curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.maxlimit
variable.comment: Set Max Limit for the Cache. This sets the maximum number of PooledConnections the cache can hold. There is no default MaxLimit assumed meaning connections in the cache could reach as many as the database allows.

variable.name: curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.initiallimit
variable.comment: Set the Initial Limit. This sets the size of the connection cache when the cache is initially created or reinitialized. When this property is set to a value greater than 0, then that number of connections are pre-created and are ready for use.

variable.name: curam.db.oracle.connectioncache.name
variable.comment: The name used to identify the cache uniquely.

variable.name: curam.db.zos.32ktablespace
variable.comment: Property which specifies the name of the table space used for 32k storage on DB2 z/OS.

variable.name: curam.db.zos.enableforeignkeys
variable.comment:
Controls whether foreign keys are generated for a z/OS database when running the Data Manager. Note on usage - If Foreign Keys are used against a z/OS database, the tables are put in a CHECK_PENDING state, causing failures when the tables are accessed. The state can only be changed through direct DBA intervention on the target platform (hence it cannot be scripted into the Data Manager which can run on remote clients).
In normal usage the Data Manager invokes LOB Manager after applying the foreign keys. This means the LOB manager should be re-run after the this CHECK_PENDING state has been resolved.

variable.name: curam.db.disableforeignkeys
variable.comment: Controls whether foreign keys are generated in SQL statements. By default this property is false, which means foreign key generation is enabled. However, for z/OS foreign keys will not be generated if curam.db.zos.enableforeignkeys is set to false.

variable.name: curam.db.disableInvalidLobFileError
variable.comment: This property controls the reporting of invalid LOB file paths in DMX files. The default value is FALSE. By default a build exception will be thrown, when set to TRUE a warning will be reported.

variable.name: curam.db.zos.encoding
variable.comment: Property which specifies whether the database being used on z/OS requires processing for EBCDIC, ASCII, or UNICODE encoding. This should be set to EBCDIC, ASCII, or UNICODE depending on the appropriate database encoding in use. EBCDIC is the default value.

variable.name: curam.db.zos.dbname
variable.comment: The name of the database on z/OS.

variable.name: curam.database.shortnames
variable.comment: It is strongly recommended that this property be set to false. The functionality for this property is planned for removal in a future version of Curam. If you have utilized this property in previous versions of Curam please contact Curam Support for more information.

variable.name: curam.db.oracle.servicename
variable.comment: The Oracle database service name. Setting this will create database connection using Oracle service name.

variable.name: curam.db.name
variable.comment: The database name. This setting will be overridden if property "curam.db.oracle.servicename" is set for Oracle database.

variable.name: curam.db.servername
variable.comment: The database server name.

variable.name: curam.db.serverport
variable.comment: Suggested: 1521 (Oracle)/ 50000 (DB2). The database server TCP/IP port.

variable.name: curam.db.enable.bindings.generation
variable.comment: Suggested: false. Causes a bindings file to be generated for the JDBC data source when a database connection is made outside of the application server, e.g. by the Batch Launcher. Has no effect if property 'curam.db.disable.bindings.generation' is set. Intended to be used to produce a starter bindings file which can then be customized.

variable.name: curam.db.disable.bindings.generation
variable.comment: Suggested: false. Prevents re-generation of the JDBC data source bindings file and instead causes the data source to be looked up from a customized bindings file when a database connection is made outside of the application server, e.g. by the Batch Launcher.

variable.name: curam.dmx.locale
variable.comment: Default: en. Property that specifies the locale that will be used when inserting dmx data onto the database. The locale should be specified in the format: language_country, for example en_US.

variable.name: curam.db.multibyte.expansion
variable.comment: Enables the multi-byte expansion feature. Default value is true.

variable.name: curam.db.multibyte.default.factor
variable.comment: Specifies the default expansion factor for multi byte string fields if multi byte expansion is enabled. Must be a float between the values of 1 and 4. Default value is 4.

variable.name: curam.db2.purescale
variable.comment: Default: false. Indicates that the DB2 pureScale property, enableSysplexWLB, will be set for the DB2 DataSource and WebSphere configuration.

variable.name: curam.db2.ssl
variable.comment: Default: false. Indicates that SSL is to be used for DB2 database communications."

variable.name: curam.db2.ssl.truststore.location
variable.comment: Specifies the SSL trust store location to be used for secure DB2 database communications. Default: null."

variable.name: curam.db2.ssl.truststore.password
variable.comment: Specifies the SSL trust store password to be used for secure DB2 database communications. Default: null."

variable.name: curam.db.zos.usebigint
variable.comment: Default: true. Indicates that DB2 for z/OS should use BIGINT instead of VARCHAR FOR BIT DATA (legacy).

section.name: Environment
section.comment: These settings configure the environment for your Curam application.

variable.name: curam.environment.as.vendor
variable.comment: Suggested: Should be set to BEA or IBM to reflect the Application Server which is being used. If running outside an application server this should be empty. Defines the Application Server in which Curam will be deployed. This is setup automatically when the EAR file is built using the build targets.

variable.name: curam.environment.tnameserv.port
variable.comment: Suggested: 1221. Port on which the tnameserv is running.

variable.name: curam.environment.bindings.location
variable.comment: Suggested: C:/Temp. Name of the file system location containing data sources.

variable.name: curam.environment.default.dateformat
variable.comment: Default: yyyy MM dd. The date format. Can be set to one of: "d M yyyy", "M d yyyy", "yyyy M d", "dd MM yyyy", "MM dd yyyy", "yyyy MM dd", "d MMM yyyy", "MMM d yyyy", "yyyy MMM d", "d MMM yyyy", "MMMM d yyyy", "yyyy MMMM d", "dd MMM yyyy", "MMM dd yyyy", "yyyy MMM dd".

variable.name: curam.environment.default.dateseparator
variable.comment: The date separator. Can be set to one of: ".", ",", "/", "-".

variable.name: curam.environment.default.timeformat
variable.comment: Default: HH mm ss. The time format. Can be set to one of: "hh mm ss a", "hh mm a", "HH mm", "HH mm ss".

variable.name: curam.environment.default.timeseparator
variable.comment: The time separator. Can be set to one of: ":", ".".

variable.name: curam.disable.dynamic.properties
variable.comment: Indicates if dynamic properties should be enabled or disabled. This is used by command line tools that require access to properties but cannot access the database.

variable.name: curam.deprecation.reporting
variable.comment: Indicates if deprecation reporting should be enabled or disabled. This is used by all tools (both online and offline) that report deprecation warnings to the user (e.g. rules and workflow validation).

variable.name: curam.entity.struct.deprecation
variable.comment: Indicates if generated entity standard structs should be deprecated if an entity is deprecated. This is used by generators which generate standard entity structs.

variable.name: curam.environment.roundingprecision.enable
variable.comment: Indicates if when rounding money types in Curam, the HALF_UP algorithm will be used. This means that all Money will be rounded up. If set to true, the HALF_UP algorithm will be used. If not set, a default of true is used.

variable.name: curam.environment.max.open.tabs
variable.comment: Defines the maximum number of tabs that are allowed to be open in an application. If this value is set to zero, there is no limit on the number of tabs that can be opened in an application.

variable.name: curam.environment.enable.timeout.warning.modal
variable.comment: Indicates that the timout warning modal dialog should be displayed to the user before the current session is expires in an external application. This modal dialog is disabled by default.

variable.name: curam.environment.timeout.warning.modal.time
variable.comment: Configures the period of time in seconds that a user has to respond to a timeout warning dialog before the the current session is expires. The default time period is 120 seconds in an external application.

variable.name: curam.environment.timeout.warning.modal.logoutpage
variable.comment: Configures the logout page identifier associated with a Quit button within the timeout warning dialog in an external application. The default logout page identifier is LoginWrapper.

variable.name: curam.environment.internal.enable.timeout.warning.modal
variable.comment: Indicates that the timout warning modal dialog should be displayed to the user before the current session is expires in an internal application. This modal dialog is disabled by default.

variable.name: curam.environment.internal.timeout.warning.modal.time
variable.comment: Configures the period of time in seconds that a user has to respond to a timeout warning dialog before the the current session is expires in an internal application. The default time period is 120 seconds.

variable.name: curam.environment.internal.timeout.warning.modal.logoutpage
variable.comment: Configures the logout page identifier associated with a Quit button within the timeout warning dialog in an internal application. Also, the logout page that shows the expired message within the timeout warning dialog in an internal application. The default logout page identifier is LoginWrapper.

variable.name: curam.environment.fallback.default.locale
variable.comment: Default: en. The fallback locale to be used for message files and codetables whereby no entry is found for the current users locale.

variable.name: curam.app.guard.against.leaving
variable.comment: Indicates whether warnings messages are enabled or disabled when the user leaves or refreshes an external application. These warnings are enabled by default.

variable.name: curam.internal.app.guard.against.leaving
variable.comment: Indicates whether warnings messages are enabled or disabled when the user leaves or refreshes an internal application. These warnings are enabled by default.

variable.name: curam.security.breakInThreshold.delimiter
variable.comment: Default: |. This property allows to specify the delimiter for the list of users whose authentication break-in threshold is disabled. The list of users can be specified by using the property 'curam.security.breakInThreshold.disabled.users'. For example, the delimiter '|' can be used as WEBSVCS|SYSTEM|DB2JMS to separate the three user names.

section.name: Test
section.comment: These settings configure those elements of Curam which are useful for Unit Testing. None of these settings should be used in a deployed application as they will either degrade performance or cause failures.

variable.name: curam.test.override.date
variable.comment: This property allows the date and time to be set to a known value for testing. In order to override the date and time the property should be in the format YYYYMMDDThhmmss. The 'T' character is the separator between the date and the time. It is valid to only specify the date. If the time portion of the property is not explicitly set the time will be automatically default to midnight (00:00:00). For example, the string value 20070101T175930 represents 17:59:30 on 1st January 2007. The string value 20070101 represents 00:00:00 on 1st January 2007.

variable.name: curam.test.treatreadmultimaxaserror
variable.comment: Default: false. Specifies that a run time error should be thrown as well as a log message when the result size of Readmulti operation exceeds the maximum. This does not apply when the Treat readmulti-max as InformationalException option is enabled

section.name: Custom
section.comment: These settings allow a developer to replace elements of the Curam infrastructure with their own customized handlers.

variable.name: curam.custom.workflow.webservicebpo
variable.comment: The name of the application BPO that workflow process enactment web services go through.

type.name: Application.prx - Dynamic properties
type.comment: The following properties relate to the available dynamic properties in the Application.prx file.

section.name: Environment
section.comment: These settings configure the environment for your Curam application.

variable.name: curam.environment.app.menu.locale.toggle.enabled
variable.comment: Specifies whether the application menu should contain a link to allow the user to change their default locale. The default is false here, that no link should be displayed.

variable.name: curam.environment.default.locale
variable.comment: Default: en. The default value of the language code for the server.

variable.name: curam.environment.recordlocked.systemexception
variable.comment: Specifies whether a RecordLockedException should be set to a System exception. The default is false here, that it is a Application exception.

variable.name: curam.environment.readmultimax.systemexception
variable.comment: Specifies whether a ReadmultiMaxException should be set to a System exception. The default is false here, that it is a Application exception.

variable.name: curam.transaction.sqlquerycache.disabled
variable.comment: Specifies whether any SQL queries that do a SELECT on a database table will have their results cached for the duration of the transaction in which the operation was invoked. Subsequent calls using the same SQL query will then retrieve the results from this thread local transaction SQL query cache and not read the results from the database. The default setting for disabling this cache is false so that the results of SQL queries will be cached.

variable.name: curam.sqlquerycache.lob.max.size
variable.comment: Specifies the maximum size of a field of type CLOB or type BLOB in a result set that is allowed to be cached in the transaction SQL query cache.

variable.name: curam.enable.logging.client.authcheck
variable.comment: Default: false. When set to true, all client authorization checks will be logged to the AuthorisationLog database table.

variable.name: curam.audit.audittrail.datacompressionthreshold
variable.comment: Specifies the size of the audit data stored in the detailinfo column of the audittrail database table that causes data compression to be invoked. Default: -1 (off). This value is checked per audit operation. To turn compression on for all audittrail detailinfo data set this value to 0. When turned on rows that contain compressed data have the boolean attribute ISCOMPRESSED set to true. Note that short audit data is not likely to see performance gains, but will for large data rows. The performance of Curam auditing OOTB should not require compression, but if you add additional auditing you should evaluate your auditing selections for performance to determine the best setting for this value. Compression is done via the curam.util.resources.ByteArrayUtil.byteArrayToBase64EncodedString method and decompression can be done via the corresponding ByteArrayUtil.base64EncodedStringToByteArray method.

variable.name: curam.message.enable.codetable.error
variable.comment: Default: false. When set to true, an error is thrown if a code table code that does not exist is passed to the MessageUtil class when constructing a message that contains a code table.

variable.name: curam.cdsl.development_mode
variable.comment: Indicates whether CDSL development mode is enabled. It is disabled by default.

variable.name: curam.environment.enable.sequential.tabs
variable.comment: Default: false. Indicates whether new tabs should be open next to their originating tab (i.e. in sequence), or at end of tab list.

variable.name: curam.referer.domains
variable.comment: Setting that defines the list of domains that will be allowed by the Curam infrastructure. Only applications with a domain matching an entry on the list will have access. Refer to the knowledge centre for guidance before enabling this feature.

variable.name: curam.financial.currencysymbol
variable.comment: Base currency symbol.

variable.name: curam.financial.currencysymbolplacement
variable.comment: Base currency symbol placement.

variable.name: curam.financial.localizedcurrencysymbolplacement
variable.comment: Specifies whether the placement and spacing of the currency symbol should be determined based on the current user locale using standard Java libraries or based on the global curam.financial.currencysymbolplacement and curam.financial.currencysymbol application properties. The default value is ‘false’, indicating that the global application properties should be used.

section.name: JMX
section.comment: These settings configure the JMX infrastructure for your Curam application.

variable.name: curam.jmx.monitoring_enabled
variable.comment: Whether JMX monitoring is enabled or not in the application.

variable.name: curam.jmx.transaction_tracing_enabled
variable.comment: Whether transaction tracing is enabled or not in the application. When this is enabled, in-flight data collection is enabled as well.

variable.name: curam.jmx.transaction_tracing_url_filter
variable.comment: Regular expression to identify URLs for which transaction tracing data is collected.

variable.name: curam.jmx.transaction_tracing_max_recorded_threads
variable.comment: The maximum number of threads for which transaction tracing data is collected. Note that at any one moment there could be more than this number of threads in the transaction tracing data but a significant amount of entries will only be preserved for this number of threads.

variable.name: curam.jmx.transaction_tracing_purge_period
variable.comment: The period of time, in seconds, between checks to ensure that only the number of threads specified in curam.jmx.transaction_tracing_max_recorded_threads are preserved in the transaction tracing data.

variable.name: curam.jmx.transaction_tracing_max_thread_idle_time
variable.comment: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, a thread is allowed to be idle before its transaction tracing data can be cleared.

variable.name: curam.jmx.configured_mbeans_ejb
variable.comment: The list of MBeans configured in the EJB container.

variable.name: curam.jmx.configured_mbeans_web
variable.comment: The list of MBeans configured in the WEB container.

variable.name: curam.jmx.per_user_statistics_filter
variable.comment: Regular expression to identify users for which individual statistics are collected.

variable.name: curam.jmx.in_flight_statistics_enabled
variable.comment: Whether or not statistics about in-flight transactions are collected.

variable.name: curam.jmx.sql_statement_statistics_enabled
variable.comment: Whether or not SQL statement statistics collection is enabled.

variable.name: curam.jmx.download_statistics_allowed
variable.comment: Whether or not the download of JMX statistics is allowed.

variable.name: curam.jmx.download_statistics_username
variable.comment: The username of the user who is allowed to download the JMX statistics.

variable.name: curam.jmx.end_user_statistics_enabled
variable.comment: Whether or not end user statistics collection is enabled.

variable.name: curam.jmx.end_user_statistics_user_filter
variable.comment: Regular expression that selects users for which end user statistics are collected.

variable.name: curam.jmx.end_user_statistics_display_enabled
variable.comment: Whether or not the end user statistics are displayed in the browser. If true, the statistics for the current page are displayed in the top left corner of the page.

variable.name: curam.jmx.end_user_statistics_upload_delay
variable.comment: The delay in seconds between the page reporting being loaded and the moment the statistics are uploaded.

section.name: Test
section.comment: These settings configure those elements of Curam which are useful for Unit Testing. None of these settings should be used in a deployed application as they will either degrade performance or cause failures.

variable.name: curam.test.store.entitykeys
variable.comment: Default: false. Specifies that the values written to the database should be stored in memory for retrieval by tests. They can be accessed through curam.util.DataAccess.KeyRepository.

variable.name: curam.test.trace.statistics
variable.comment: Default: false. Place a compact trace of BO method invocations in a buffered log. This representation is suitable for obtaining performance measurements.

variable.name: curam.test.trace.statistics.location
variable.comment: The name of the file which will have the statistics information generated into it.

variable.name: curam.test.singleuser
variable.comment: Indicates whether only a single user will be active. This is the only mode supported if an IDE is used to execute Curam as a standalone Java program.

variable.name: curam.test.stubdeferredprocessing
variable.comment: Default: false. Specifies that it needs to use deferred processing without en-queuing in App Server.

variable.name: curam.test.stubdeferredprocessinsametransaction
variable.comment: Default: false. Specifies that stubbed deferred process calls should be run in the current transaction using the current database connection. If true, a new transaction will not be started for each stubbed deferred process call.

section.name: Rules
section.comment: These settings configure the rules infrastructure of Curam.

variable.name: curam.rules.file.access.location
variable.comment: The directory where the XML representation of rule sets will be created.

variable.name: curam.rules.file.access.multilocation
variable.comment: Specifies that rule set files exist in multiple locations.

variable.name: curam.rules.model.file.rdo.access
variable.comment: Specifies that RDOs should be retrieved from a Curam model file.

variable.name: curam.rules.default.locale
variable.comment: Default: en_US. Default locale used when creating the XML representation of rule sets.

variable.name: curam.rules.globals.description
variable.comment: The display/user friendly name associated with the pre-defined Globals Rules Data Object. The default value is the localized message text associated with the infrastructure catalog entry: RULES:ID_GROUP_DISPLAY_NAME_GLOBALS

variable.name: curam.rules.enable.optimization
variable.comment: Specifies the rules optimization.

variable.name: curam.rules.enable.fulltext
variable.comment: Specifies the rules engine construction of full result text.

variable.name: curam.debug.rules
variable.comment: Default: false. Specify whether the rules debugging should be enabled.

variable.name: curam.disable.empty.objectivelistgroups
variable.comment: Default: true. Specify whether the rules decision should include empty Objective list groups.

variable.name: curam.classicrules.relatedreference.compatabilityworkaround
variable.comment: Default: false. Specify whether the Objective related reference values should be stored in the tag values to fix the issues with financial amount calculation.

variable.name: curam.rules.date.range.includes.calculation.date
variable.comment: Specifies the new objective calculation.

section.name: IEG
section.comment: These settings configure the properties which relate to the IEG Environment. These properties are deprecated since Curam 5.2. The IEG infrastructure was replaced by a new version.

variable.name: curam.iegeditor.callback.class
variable.comment: Deprecated since Curam 5.2 - Specifies the IEG Editor Application Callbacks class.

variable.name: curam.iegruntime.questionpage.separatequestionsforloopstyle
variable.comment: Deprecated since Curam 5.2 - Specifies whether to use separate question pages when "for" looping.

section.name: ActionMenus
section.comment: These settings enable a system administrator to configure action menus (tab, page, list) to have visibly surfaceable menu items outside of the overflow menu icon.

variable.name: curam.actionmenus.display-inline.enabled.page
variable.comment: Enables page actions to be displayed inline on the page and immediately available to users. By default, the value is false. When set to true, one page action is displayed inline by default. Actions that are not displayed inline overflow into the page action menu.

variable.name: curam.actionmenus.max-inline-items.page
variable.comment: Specifies the maximum number of action menu items to display inline on the page. Actions that are not displayed inline overflow into the page action menu. A maximum value of 4 is recommended. Set a value of 0 to place all page actions in the page actions menu.

variable.name: curam.actionmenus.display-inline.enabled.list
variable.comment: Enables list actions to be displayed inline on the list row and immediately available to users. By default, the value is false. When set to true, one list action is displayed inline by default. Actions that are not displayed inline overflow into the list action menu.

variable.name: curam.actionmenus.max-inline-items.list
variable.comment: Specifies the maximum number of action menu items to display inline on the list row. Actions that are not displayed inline overflow into the list action menu. A maximum value of 2 is recommended. Set a value of 0 to place all list actions in the list actions menu.

variable.name: curam.actionmenus.display-inline.enabled.tab
variable.comment: Enables tab actions to be displayed inline on the tab action menu and immediately available to users. By default, the value is false. When set to true, two tab actions are displayed inline by default. Actions that are not displayed inline overflow into the tab action menu.

variable.name: curam.actionmenus.max-inline-items.tab
variable.comment: Specifies the maximum number of action menu items to display inline on a tab. Actions that are not displayed inline overflow into the tab action menu. A maximum value of 4 is recommended. Set a value of 0 to place all list actions in the tab action menu.

section.name: Custom
section.comment: These settings allow a developer to replace elements of the Curam infrastructure with their own customized handlers.

variable.name: curam.custom.deferredprocessing.dpcallback
variable.comment: The name of the application class that implements the DPCallback interface.

variable.name: curam.custom.workflow.workresolver
variable.comment: The name of the application class that implements the WorkResolver interface.

variable.name: curam.custom.workflow.processcachesize
variable.comment: Default: 250. Specifies the maximum size of the process definition cache.

variable.name: curam.audit.audittrail.noxmlaudit
variable.comment: If set to true this property will disable the existing audit writer.

variable.name: curam.custom.notifications.notificationdelivery
variable.comment: Specifies the name of the application class that implements the NotificationDelivery interface.

variable.name: curam.custom.dataaccess.databasewritecallback
variable.comment: The name of the application class that implements the DatabaseWriteCallback interface.

variable.name: curam.custom.dataaccess.transactioncallback
variable.comment: The name of the application class that implements the TransactionCallback interface.

variable.name: curam.custom.disable.database.callback
variable.comment: If set to true this property will disable the database callback.

section.name: Trace
section.comment: These control what diagnostic information (in addition to errors which are always logged) is written to the application server's diagnostics file. Note that you can set the "curam.trace.*" settings independently of the "curam.trace" settings, resulting in the union of these settings.

variable.name: curam.trace
variable.comment: Default: trace_off. Tracing is off by default. Turn tracing on by setting the property to trace_on, trace_verbose or trace_ultra_verbose. The value trace_on is equivalent to setting curam.trace.servercalls to true. The value trace_verbose is equivalent to setting curam.trace.servercalls, curam.trace.methods and curam.trace.sql to true, while the highest trace level "trace_ultra_verbose" is equivalent to setting curam.trace.* to true

variable.name: curam.trace.dynamic.uim
variable.comment: Default: false. Trace Curam dynamic UIM.

variable.name: curam.trace.servercalls
variable.comment: Default: false. Trace server method invocations by remote clients.

variable.name: curam.trace.methods
variable.comment: Default: false. Trace all business object (BO) method invocations.

variable.name: curam.trace.method_args
variable.comment: Default: false. Dump arguments to BO method invocations, including the argument type. This option is only valid if curam.trace.methods is set to true or curam.trace is set to at least trace_verbose.

variable.name: curam.trace.sql
variable.comment: Default: false. Trace SQL statements executed by entity objects.

variable.name: curam.trace.sql_args
variable.comment: Default: false. Dump results of SQL select statements.

variable.name: curam.trace.rules
variable.comment: Default: false. Trace Curam rules execution.

variable.name: curam.trace.smtp
variable.comment: Default: false. Trace the calls to the SMTP server.

variable.name: curam.trace.configfile.location
variable.comment: The location of the ".xml" configuration file which controls the output of logging within Curam.

variable.name: curam.trace.oracle.cachehits
variable.comment: Default: false. An indicator as to whether the cache hits and misses of the Oracle prepared statement cache should be output.

variable.name: curam.trace.ejb.invocation_differentiators
variable.comment: Comma separated list of invocation differentiator implementations.

variable.name: curam.trace.suppress_optimistic_locking_detail
variable.comment: Default: false. Suppress SQL detail from being dumped when optimistic locking exceptions occur.

variable.name: curam.trace.suppress_database_exception_detail
variable.comment: Default: false. Suppress SQL detail from being dumped when database exceptions occur.

variable.name: curam.trace.javascript
variable.comment: Allowed values: "true"|"false", default: "false". Enable JavaScript trace log output. Outputs debugging information into the JavaScript trace log in user's web browser.

variable.name: curam.trace.javascript.ajax.report
variable.comment: Default: false. Enable AJAX debugging mode. Outputs extra information into JavaScript trace log and displays a message to the user about every error related to AJAX requests.

variable.name: curam.trace.deferred.user.name
variable.comment: Default: true. This property will inform the application whether to log the deferred user name or the normal user name for deferred processes in the log files.

section.name: Security
section.comment: These settings configure the authentication behavior of Curam.

variable.name: curam.security.breakInThreshold
variable.comment: Default: 3. The number of consecutive break-in attempts that are allowed before an account is locked out.

variable.name: curam.security.passwordexpiry.warningperiod
variable.comment: The number of days, in advance, that a user should be warned (on login) that their password is about to expire.

variable.name: curam.security.loginattempts.warningperiod
variable.comment: Default: 1. The number of logins, in advance, that a user should be warned (on login) that they have a limited number of logins in which they must change their password.

variable.name: curam.security.cache.failure.callback
variable.comment: Specifies the security cache failure callback class.

variable.name: curam.security.disable.cache.failure.callback
variable.comment: If set to true this property will disable the security cache failure callback.

variable.name: curam.security.identifier.minsearch.stringlength
variable.comment: Specifies the security Identifier Minimum Search String Length.

variable.name: curam.security.altlogin.enabled
variable.comment: Default: false. An indicator as to whether alternate login ID support is enabled. The alternate login ID overrides the use of the Curam username for login.

variable.name: curam.security.convertsupersededpassworddigests.enabled
variable.comment: This property should only be enabled when updating the cryptography used to store digested user passwords in Curam. When enabled, the Curam login will accept logins for accounts that are still using the superseded digest encryption, but will upgrade them to the new digest encryption during login. Default: false.

variable.name: curam.security.crypto.upgrade.start
variable.comment: This property allows to store the crypto upgrade start date and time to be used by sysadmin for querying later., Whenever any crypto algorithm changes are applied, note down the date time here. The date and time the property should be in the format YYYYMMDDThhmmss. The 'T' character is the separator between the date and the time.For example, the string value 20070101T175930 represents 17:59:30 on 1st January 2007. The string value 20070101 represents 00:00:00 on 1st January 2007. Default: blank.

variable.name: curam.security.jmslite.dp.default.username
variable.comment: Default: SYSTEM. This property should only be set, when using RMI Server, to override default user for JMSLite based deferred processing.

variable.name: curam.security.cache.optimize.query
variable.comment: If set to true security cache will use optimized query for checking, default is true.

section.name: SMTP
section.comment: These settings configure the environment in which the SMTP client element of Curam operates.

variable.name: curam.mail.smtp.serverhost
variable.comment: The default mail server that is used by Curam.

variable.name: curam.mail.smtp.serverport
variable.comment: The port on which the default mail server is addressed.

variable.name: curam.mail.smtp.connectiontimeout
variable.comment: The socket connection timeout value (in seconds) of the mail server.

variable.name: curam.mail.smtp.timeout
variable.comment: The socket I/O timeout value (in seconds) of the mail server.

section.name: XMLServer
section.comment: These settings configure the environment in which the XML Server will be used.

variable.name: curam.xmlserver.host
variable.comment: The host on which the XML Print Server resides. The property may also be specified as a '/' separated list of host names in order to use multiple XML Servers. For further information please refer to the Curam XML Infrastructure Guide.

variable.name: curam.xmlserver.port
variable.comment: The port on which the XML Print Server is listening. The property may also be specified as a '/' separated list of ports in order to use multiple XML Servers. For further information please refer to the Curam XML Infrastructure Guide.

variable.name: curam.xmlserver.printer
variable.comment: The printer name that will be provided to the XML Server.

variable.name: curam.xmlserver.tray
variable.comment: The printer tray that will be provided to the XML Server.

variable.name: curam.xmlserver.fileencoding
variable.comment: The encoding that should be used for the encoding of files provided to the XMLServer.

variable.name: curam.xmlserver.serializelocaleneutral
variable.comment: Specify that xml server data will be serialized in a locale-neutral way instead of being based on the locale properties on the server.

variable.name: curam.xmlserver.client.sotimeout
variable.comment: The XMLServer client socket timeout.

section.name: Database
section.comment: These settings configure Curam for database communication.

variable.name: curam.db.readmultimax
variable.comment: Default: 100. Allows the developer to override the default maximum number of records returned by the readmulti (readmulti, nsreadmulti, nkreadmulti and nsmulti) operations in an application. This default value is only used if an explicit value is not set in the model.

variable.name: curam.db.locktimeout
variable.comment: Default: 30. Allows the developer to set the lock timeout in seconds on an Oracle database when performing a singleton select FOR UPDATE. The syntax here is to append a WAIT XX clause to the statement. This default value is only used if an explicit value is not set.

variable.name: curam.db.batch.limit
variable.comment: Default: 10. Globally defines the number of updates that can be grouped together as part of a batch update.

section.name: KeyServer
section.comment: These settings allow a customer to configure the behavior of the KeyServer.

variable.name: curam.keyserver.default.unique.set
variable.comment: The name of the default key set used by the application.

variable.name: curam.keyserver.retry
variable.comment: Default: 5. The number of retries that will be performed if there is a problem communicating with the key server before that problem is reported to the user.

variable.name: curam.keyserver.support
variable.comment: Default: false. The range aware key server algorithm allows usage of group from 3 to 32,768. But as group 2 is to allocated for Cúram support.This property can be set to true to state keys generated are for Cúram support purpose.

variable.name: curam.keyserver.remaining.keyblock.notification
variable.comment: Default: 100000000. The range aware key server algorithm supply a notification to administrators when a particular key set is nearing the end of the systems allocated range.This notification would be sent repeatedly at defined magnitude intervals before exhaustion e.g. the first message sent when there are X key blocks remaining for the key set, the next when there are X/10 key blocks remaining etc. Range Aware Key Server send these notifications only in case if there are no further ranges allocated to the system.

variable.name: curam.keyserver.keyset.cachesize
variable.comment: Default: 1 : Specifies the number of unique ID keysets to be consumed and cached per Key Server transaction.

section.name: BatchLauncher
section.comment: These settings configure the behavior of Curam when problems occur invoking batch programs.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.erroremail.recipient
variable.comment: The email address of the recipient of error emails from Curam.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.erroremail.nostacktrace
variable.comment: Default: false. Suppress the stack trace in the error emails.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.default.error.code
variable.comment: Default: 1. The default error code returned by a batch program.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.enabled
variable.comment: Default: false. Specifies whether deferred processing and workflow functionality for batch programs should be enabled. When set to true the curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.host and curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.port properties must also be set.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.host
variable.comment: Default: localhost. Specifies whether the host on which the database-to-JMS listener is available. This property must be set when the curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.enabled property is set to true.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.contextroot
variable.comment: The context root used by the Curam web client. Default value = 'Curam'.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.port
variable.comment: Default: 9044. Specifies whether the port on which the database-to-JMS notification listener is available. This property must be set when the curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.enabled property is set to true.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.ssl
variable.comment: Default: true. Specifies that the database-to-JMS notification listener on the application server is using SSL.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.encoding
variable.comment: Specifies the encoding of the database-to-JMS listener.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.batchlaunchermode
variable.comment: Specifies the db-to-jms mode for the batch launcher. 0=none, 1=once per batch launcher session, 2=once per batch job.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.disabled.in.standalone
variable.comment: Specifies that the batch launcher should not perform a db-to-jms notification when run in standalone mode.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.test.stubtrigger
variable.comment: Default: false. For debugging batch jobs which use DBtoJMS: stubs out DBtoJMS.beginTransfer() to prevent it from creating deferred processes. JMSLiteEngine must be started to process the messages.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.messagespertransaction
variable.comment: Default: 512. The number of messages per transaction processed by the database-to-JMS conversion.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.ssl.protocol
variable.comment: Default: SSL. The protocol name appropriate and valid for your environment, which is dependent on your JDK and application server; e.g.: SSL, TLS, etc. For this property to be used curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.ssl must be set affirmatively.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.ltpa
variable.comment: Default: false. Specifies whether the batch launcher will login to obtain LTPA token before triggering a DBtoJMS transfer.

variable.name: curam.batchlauncher.dbtojms.notification.trace
variable.comment: Default: false. Enables tracing of DBtoJMS notification at run time.

section.name: Workflow
section.comment: These settings configure the properties which relate to the Workflow Environment.

variable.name: curam.workflow.disable.audit.wdovalueshistory.before.activity
variable.comment: When specified to true, this flag will ensure that no WDO values history audit information will be written before an activity is executed.

variable.name: curam.workflow.disable.audit.wdovalueshistory.after.activity
variable.comment: When specified to true, this flag will ensure that no WDO values history audit information will be written after an activity is executed.

variable.name: curam.workflow.disable.audit.wdovalueshistory.transition.evaluation
variable.comment: When specified to true, this flag will ensure that no WDO values history audit information will be written before the transitions from an activity are evaluated.

section.name: CTM
section.comment: These settings configure the properties which relate to configuration transport manager.

variable.name: curam.ctm.landscape.name
variable.comment: Default: nolandscape. The landscape name for configuration transport manager to transport change set from source to target systems with in the configured landscape.

section.name: SessionManagement
section.comment: Contains all the configurations for the Session Management.

variable.name: curam.sessionmanagement.tabsession.curamformsapi.enabled
variable.comment: Indicates whether the CuramFormsAPI is enabled. If the value is set to false, the CuramFormsAPI will not register components and does not set fields when requested nor notify of change.

variable.name: curam.sessionmanagement.tabsession.autorecovery.enabled
variable.comment: Indicates whether the system automatically recovers unsaved data for users and returns them to where they were in the application if a system interruption such as a timeout occurs. This property applies to all application areas where autorecovery is supported. If the value is set to true, the system returns the user to where they were and recovers any data that users entered without saving before the interruption occurred. If the value is set to false, the system does not recover unsaved data in any areas of the application.

variable.name: curam.sessionmanagement.tabsession.autorecovery.throttleinterval
variable.comment: The delay, in milliseconds, to be applied between autorecovery post requests to the server. This property applies to all application areas where autorecovery is supported. Th default value is 500. A value less than 1 will turn autorecovery off.

type.name: Application.prx - Static properties
type.comment: The following properties relate to the available static properties in the Application.prx file.

section.name: Custom
section.comment: These settings allow a developer to replace elements of the Curam infrastructure with their own customized handlers.

variable.name: curam.custom.audit.writer
variable.comment: Default: curam.util.internal.misc.StandardDatabaseAudit. The name of the class which will handle the generated audit information. This class must extend curam.util.audit.AuditLogInterface. curam.util.audit.DisabledAudit may be used to globally disable auditing.

variable.name: curam.custom.predataaccess.hook
variable.comment: The name of the class that implements the interface curam.util.audit.DataAccessHook.

variable.name: curam.custom.external.operation.hook
variable.comment: Specifies the fully qualified class name of the customized external operation Hook which implements curam.util.audit.ExternalOperationHook. An external operation is an operation callable as a remote, batch, webservice or deferred process call.

section.name: Security
section.comment: These settings configure the authentication behavior of Curam.

variable.name: curam.security.disable.authorisation
variable.comment: Default: false. Suppress the authorization checks normally performed by Curam.

variable.name: curam.security.casesensitive
variable.comment: Authentication and authorization of usernames is case sensitive by default. When this property is set to false the authentication and authorization mechanisms will ignore the case of the user. If duplicate case insensitive user names exist (e.g. caseworker, CaseWorker), authentication will fail due to an ambiguous user name. Such duplicate names will also cause the security cache to fail to initialize.

variable.name: curam.custom.externalaccess.implementation
variable.comment: The fully qualified name of the class implementing the curam.util.security.ExternalAccessSecurity interface. This class implements the custom authentication mechanism for External Users.

variable.name: curam.custom.authentication.implementation
variable.comment: The fully qualified name of the class implementing the curam.util.security.CustomAuthenticator interface. This class implements custom authentication verifications that will be invoked during the authentication process.

variable.name: curam.custom.userscope.implementation
variable.comment: The fully qualified name of the class implementing the curam.util.security.UserScope interface. This class determines the type of User logging into the application, i.e. INTERNAL or EXTERNAL.

variable.name: curam.security.breakInThreshold.disabled.users
variable.comment: This property allows to specify the list of users whose authentication break-in threshold is disabled. The user names in the list are delimited by '|' symbol by default but a different delimiter can be specified by using the property 'curam.security.breakInThreshold.disabled.users.delimiter'. For example, list of users can be specified as WEBSVCS|SYSTEM|DB2JMS.

variable.name: curam.security.default.system.users
variable.comment: A list of internal default user names used by the system.

section.name: Trace
section.comment: These control what diagnostic information (in addition to errors which are always logged) is written to the application server's diagnostics file.

variable.name: curam.trace.method_handler
variable.comment: Default: curam.util.resources.Trace.CuramMethodInvocationHandlerDefault. Name of a class implementing curam.util.resources.Trace.CuramMethodInvocationHandler to perform custom method tracing.

variable.name: curam.trace.dataaccess.maxstringlength
variable.comment: Default: 1000. Maximum length of a String or CLOB logged by the Data Access Layer when SQL tracing is enabled.

section.name: Environment
section.comment: These settings configure the environment for your Curam application.

variable.name: curam.project.name
variable.comment: This parameter is required by the Rules and Workflow engines to dynamically invoke methods in the application.

variable.name: curam.disable.tab.cache
variable.comment: Default: false. Indicates if tab caching should be disabled. Note, this only applies to caching on the server side.
